DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Tumor Tissue First Surgical Clamp Date and Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date or date and time when the first surgical device such as a clamp is applied to a tumor sample to reduce or stop blood flow.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Tumor Tissue First Surgical Clamp
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A surgical device used for compressing or holding an anatomic structure or other object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A surgical device used for compressing or holding an anatomic structure or other object.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A surgical device used for compressing or holding an anatomic structure or other object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/26/21 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval. 9/29/20 jk created CPTAC Solid tumor procurement CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date or date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
